citation.article-title: Comparative systematic study on "Spirillum" 5175, Campylobacter and Wolinella species.

p.s: Sulfurospirillum (Sul. fu. ro. spi. ril' lum. L. sulfur sulfur; Gr. n. spira a spiral; M. L. dim. neut. n. Spirillum a small spiral. M. L. neut. n. Sulfurospirillum a spirillum that reduces elemental sulfur)
Slender cells, curved, vibrioid to spirilloid, 0.3 to 0.5 μm wide and 1.0 to 3 μm long, helical chains of two or more cells may occur.
Microaerophilic, with a respiratory type of metabolism, succinate, fumarate, malate or pyruvate but not acetate oxidized.
Carbohydrates are neither oxidized nor fermented.
Under anoxic conditions fumarate and malate are fermented.

With hydrogen or formate as electron donor and acetate plus hydrogen carbonate as carbon sources oxidized nitrogen and sulfur compounds (but not sulfate) and elemental sulfur can be used as electron acceptors.
No growth in the presence of 1% glycine or 3.5% NaCl.
Found in anoxic or microoxic aquatic freshwater habitats with decaying organic matter.
The mol% G + C of the DNA ranges from 38-42.
